newsitem.title: USA: U.S. team delays China poultry trip.
newsitem.headline: U.S. team delays China poultry trip.

text.p: A U.S. Department of Agriculture team has delayed a trip to China aimed at ending a dispute over poultry imports because of visa problems, a USDA official said Monday.
Foreign Agriculture Service Associate Administrator Tim Galvin said the technical team, which was scheduled to fly to Beijing this week, would now leave next week.
"They weren't able to get visas," Galvin said.
The delegation was put together to try to persuade Beijing to reverse a recent decision banning poultry from 10 U.S. states from entering China because of avian influenza fears.
Galvin said U.S. poultry exporters had reported that disruption from the announced ban so far had been small.
He also said a separate delegation headed by Assistant U.S. Trade Representative Lee Sands would bring the issue up in meetings in China this week.
